name: pigz

options.description: Compression level (level 11, zopfli, is much slower)
Compression levels 1 and 9 respectively
Use xxx as the name for any --zip entry from stdin
Set compression block size to mmmK (default 128K)
Write all processed output to stdout (won't delete)
Put comment ccc in the gzip or zip header
Decompress the compressed input
Force overwrite, compress .gz, links, and to terminal
Do iterations first, before block split for -11
Display a help screen and quit
Use only Huffman coding for compression
Compress blocks independently for damage recovery
Number of iterations for -11 optimization
Maximum number of split blocks for -11
Do not delete original file after processing
Compress to PKWare zip (.zip) single entry format
List the contents of the compressed input
Display the pigz license and quit
Do not store or restore mod time
Store or restore mod time
Do not store or restore file name or mod time
Store or restore file name and mod time
Do not split into smaller blocks for -11
Allow up to n compression threads (default is the number of online processors, or 8 if unknown)
Print no messages, even on error
Process the contents of all subdirectories
Input-determined block locations for rsync
Use suffix .sss instead of .gz (for compression)
Test the integrity of the compressed input
Use run-length encoding for compression
Provide more verbose output
Show the version of pigz
Force output file write to permanent storage
Compress to zlib (.zz) instead of gzip format
All arguments after "--" are treated as files

tldr:
> Multithreaded zlib compression utility.
> More information: <https://github.com/madler/pigz>.

- Compress a file with default options:

`pigz {{filename}}`

- Compress a file using the best compression method:

`pigz -9 {{filename}}`

- Compress a file using no compression and 4 processors:

`pigz -0 -p{{4}} {{filename}}`

- Compress a directory using tar:

`tar cf - {{path/to/directory}} | pigz > {{filename}}.tar.gz`

- Decompress a file:

`pigz -d {{archive.gz}}`

- List the contents of an archive:

`pigz -l {{archive.tar.gz}}`
